author: axic3354
content: Made a lot of updates to https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/eof1-checklist  for tracking progress, including links to all implementations and tests, plus a summary table.

author: axic3354
content: Green means merged, construction means PR is in progress, red means no PR found.

author: .domlord
content: I apologize in advance if this is not the correct thread/server to ask these sorts of questions, but I am looking into what it takes to decompiles solidity smart contracts (w/ Ghidra or r2) and I was wondering if anyone had any resources or learning materials. I'm currrently in a Compilers undergraduate course and I am overall attempting to find a "compilation architecture" which best prevents decompilation attempts/debugging. I've read the yellow paper, and have been working with the Ghidra-evm framework for a few weeks, but thought it might not hurt to see if others have resources.

author: _shemnon
content: Wrong channel.  This is for low level EVM R&D.  Try looking at Solidity forums, although I don't know one offhand that addresses EVM reverse compilation.

author: bobsummerwill
content:
Thanks for the update, Alex.  Very helpful matrix.

Just FYI, I had a long call with Alexey yesterday, to coordinate on Erigon EOF.   So <@530585345910374404> and <@129229303719133184> will be taking that work on and plan to implement all of the EIPs for Erigon as a top priority for us.  <@636584434010816532> is already working on Besu EOF EIPs (he just started on static jumps and subroutines), and he has Besu at tip of Shandong in its current form.

If there is anything we can usefully do on SOLC, we would love to help there too.
I am already coordinating with Bryant on the Vyper side.

author: axic3354
content: I think Solidity should be fine now, we have 4 people working on the topic during December.

author: axic3354
content: I was planning to add Solidity/Vyper to the matrix once they make some progress.

author: axic3354
content: Awesome news on Erigon and Besu!
